this is a joke

I simply want to cut the ends off some videos so I can upload them. VidCutter should be able to do this. It almost does.
One can play the video and define a start and end point for the video that should be cut out. Saving the video works, but it crashes the application. So I need to force close it each time.
The resulting video exists and has been closed properly as a saved file. Unfortunately the video has not been cut where I asked it to be cut. For a one hour video I was left with 17 seconds of extra video at the beginning. Half of what I was trying to cut off.
Not worth using at this stage of development.
Instead I think I will learn to use some simple video editing package and cut the videos there.
If there are updates, I would like to see:
 - zoom in the timeline in order to better select exactly where the cut should be
 - maybe a frame by frame keyboard shortcut to get the start cut just right.
I would need to see:
 - the cuts should be made where I asked them to be made.
 - the program should not crash, even if it is working
It is just a time and data waste

As of 2021-09-23, the Snap installation is broken. It looks like it's missing some dependencies which prevents it from accessing the storage (along with other things). This results in being able to edit a video but not being able to browser for one to open it or save it.

I would suggest using the author's official PPA which actually works. See link below (which hopefully doesn't get removed - if it does, search for the Pete Alexandrou (aka ozmartin) to find his PPA on 'launchpad').

Link: https://launchpad.net/~ozmartian

description: Temps de chargement assez long, la vidéo est bien coupée mais l'interface graphique indique que le travail est toujours en cours.

Une interface apparemment sympa mais :
* extrèmement imprecis sur la sélection des points de coupure (pas d'image par image réel, impossible de revenir en arrière)
* divers bugs lors du play de la vidéo (parfois se met à jouer tout seul ou n'affiche plus la vidéo)
Mais surtout comme d'autres l'ont vu, l'export de marche pas (l'écran devient gris et rien ne se passe, le processus de transformation ne se lance pas, pas de fichier créé) rendant l'application totalement inutile...

Par ailleurs l'application est un snap qui pose les problèmes habituels d'accès aux fichiers utilisateurs s'ils ne sont pas dans les chemins permis par défaut ce qui est souvent le cas pour des fichiers volumineux comme les sources vidéo. ARRETEZ LES SNAPS OBLIGATOIRES. Laissez un package standard au choix pour ce genre d'appli ou faites sauter ces contraintes.
summary: Inutilisable n'essayez même pas (l'export ne marche pas)
